newsitem.title: USA: Game Financial loses one deal, renews one.
newsitem.headline: Game Financial loses one deal, renews one.

text.p: Game Financial Corp said on Wednesday it failed to renew a deal under which it provides credit card cash advances, check cashing and other services to customers at a Louisiana Casion until 1997, but succeeded at renewing a similar deal with a Mississipppi casino.

Game Financial said it also has received new contracts to provide some services at five properties in Nevada, South Dakota and Colorado. Altogether, Game Financial said it operates in 68 locations, up from 28 at the end of 1995 and now has agreements with seven additional gaming establishments that will become operational in the fourth quarter of 1996.

Game Financial said it received notice from the Coushatta Tribe of Louisiana that the tribe does not intend to renew its current agreement when it expires in January, 1997. The casino is managed by Grand Casinos Inc.
It said it renewed its agreement with the Tunica-Biloxi Tribe of Indians to provide services at Grand Casino Avoyelles in Mississippi.

Among the locations it has contracts to serve are Double Eagle Casino and Creekers Casino in Cripple Creek, Colo.; Goldiggers Casino in Deadwood, S.D.; and Winners Casino and Legends Casino, both in Winnemucca, Nev. All are expected to begin operations during the fourth quarter of this year.
Game Financial provides financial services including credit card cash advance, check cashing and automatic teller machine services to customers of gaming establishments.
Shares of Game Financial were trading unchanged at 10-1/4.
